(1) The National Communications Authority shall regulate the use of all communication  platforms  and  radio  spectrum  designated  or  allocated  for  use  by broadcasting organisations and providers of broadcasting services having due regard to and in accordance with the standards and requirements of the International Telecommunications Union and its Radio Regulations as agreed to or adopted by the Republic.

texts.text: 26.A licensee shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure the security and resilience of their networks and services, in accordance with standards issued by the Cybersecurity regulator.

texts.orig: (3)  A  licensee  shall,  within  twenty-four  (24)  hours  of  detection,  notify  the  National Communications Authority of any network breach involving subscriber data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 43. (1)  The  Authority  shall  control,  plan,  administer,  manage  and  license  the  radio frequency spectrum for communications and other purposes that require spectrum.
texts.text: (1)  The  Authority  shall  control,  plan,  administer,  manage  and  license  the  radio frequency spectrum for communications and other purposes that require spectrum.

texts.text: The Authority  shall  comply  with  the  applicable  standards  and  requirements  of  the International Telecommunication Union and its Radio Regulations, as agreed to or adopted by the Republic in controlling, planning, administering, managing and licensing the use of the radio frequency spectrum.

texts.label: list_item

texts.orig: 5. (1) A person who uses a subscriber identity module (SIM) or user identity module (UIM) for terminating an international call on any network in Ghana as a local call, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty units for each  SIM or  UIM  used  in  terminating  the  international  call  as  a  local  call  or  to  a  term  of imprisonment of not more than five years or to both.
texts.text: 5. (1) A person who uses a subscriber identity module (SIM) or user identity module (UIM) for terminating an international call on any network in Ghana as a local call, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty units for each  SIM or  UIM  used  in  terminating  the  international  call  as  a  local  call  or  to  a  term  of imprisonment of not more than five years or to both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) Any  person  who  deals  in  a  pre-registered  subscriber  identity  module  or  user  identity' module, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty' units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than five years or to both.
texts.text: (2) Any  person  who  deals  in  a  pre-registered  subscriber  identity  module  or  user  identity' module, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty' units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than five years or to both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)  For  the  purposes  of  this  section,  a  'pre-registered  subscriber  identify'  module  or  user identity' module"' means a module that has been registered with the data of a person other than the person who finally acquires the module for use on a network except as permitted by law.
texts.text: (3)  For  the  purposes  of  this  section,  a  'pre-registered  subscriber  identify'  module  or  user identity' module"' means a module that has been registered with the data of a person other than the person who finally acquires the module for use on a network except as permitted by law.

A  person  who  intentionally  or  negligently  gives  false  or  misleading  information  to  the Authority, concerning matters relating to the objects and functions of the Authority, commits a crime and is liable on summary conviction to fine of not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units, or to a term of imprisonment of not more than three years, or to both.
texts.text: 58. A  person  who  knowingly  transmits  or  circulates  false  or  deceptive  distress,  safety  or identification signals commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than five years, or both.
texts.text: 59.  A  person  who  knowingly  transmits  or  circulates  false  or  deceptive  distress,  safety  or identification signals commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than five years, or both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 60.  (1) A  person  who  by  means  of  electronic  communications  service,  knowingly  sends  a communication which is false or misleading and likely to prejudice the efficiency of life saving service or to endanger the safety of any person, ship, aircraft, vessel or vehicle commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than five years or to both.
texts.text: 60.  (1) A  person  who  by  means  of  electronic  communications  service,  knowingly  sends  a communication which is false or misleading and likely to prejudice the efficiency of life saving service or to endanger the safety of any person, ship, aircraft, vessel or vehicle commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than three thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than five years or to both.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2)A person is taken to know that a communication is false or misleading if that person did not take reasonable steps to find out whether the communication was false, misleading, reckless or fraudulent.
texts.text: (2)A person is taken to know that a communication is false or misleading if that person did not take reasonable steps to find out whether the communication was false, misleading, reckless or fraudulent.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)Subsection (2) does not apply to the operator or provider of a network or service over which a communication is sent.
texts.text: (3)Subsection (2) does not apply to the operator or provider of a network or service over which a communication is sent.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Recovery of civil debt
texts.text: Recovery of civil debt

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 62. Without limits to the rights that a person may have at law, a person convicted of an offence under  this  Act  is  liable  for  the  expenses  reasonably  incurred  in  the  repair,  restoration  or replacement of a computer, switch or other facility damaged, removed or destroyed by that person and the expenses are recoverable as a civil debt.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Communications during a state of emergency
texts.text: Communications during a state of emergency

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 82. (1) Where a state of emergency is declared under Article 31 of the Constitution or another law, an operator of communications or mass communications systems shall give priority to requests and orders for the transmission of voice or data that the President considers necessary in the interest of national security and defence.
texts.text: (1) Where a state of emergency is declared under Article 31 of the Constitution or another law, an operator of communications or mass communications systems shall give priority to requests and orders for the transmission of voice or data that the President considers necessary in the interest of national security and defence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) A service provider may, if facilities are disrupted as a result of force majeure or during a period of emergency, use its service for emergency communications in a manner other than specified in its licence or in the applicable regulations.
texts.text: A service provider may, if facilities are disrupted as a result of force majeure or during a period of emergency, use its service for emergency communications in a manner other than specified in its licence or in the applicable regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) The use of a service for emergency communications shall be discontinued when normal telecommunication  services  are  again  available  or  when  the  special  use  of  the  facilities, equipment or service is terminated by the President.
texts.text: The use of a service for emergency communications shall be discontinued when normal telecommunication  services  are  again  available  or  when  the  special  use  of  the  facilities, equipment or service is terminated by the President.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) Where  the  President  requires  a  licensee  or  special  licensee  to  give  priority  to communications of  the  Government, the  communications  shall  have  priority  over  all  other communications  but  be  in  accordance  with  the  International  Telecommunications  Union Treaties.
texts.text: Where  the  President  requires  a  licensee  or  special  licensee  to  give  priority  to communications of  the  Government, the  communications  shall  have  priority  over  all  other communications  but  be  in  accordance  with  the  International  Telecommunications  Union Treaties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5) A network operator or service provider shall develop and cooperate in the development and  implementation  of  plans  for  operating  networks  and  providing  services  during  force majeure  and  periods  of  serious  and  substantial  interruption  in  the  provision  of  electronic communications services.
texts.text: A network operator or service provider shall develop and cooperate in the development and  implementation  of  plans  for  operating  networks  and  providing  services  during  force majeure  and  periods  of  serious  and  substantial  interruption  in  the  provision  of  electronic communications services.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6) The President may assume direct control of the electronic communications services and issue operating regulations in the event of a war declared according to law.
texts.text: The President may assume direct control of the electronic communications services and issue operating regulations in the event of a war declared according to law.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Powers of the President
texts.text: Powers of the President

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 83.The  President  may  by  executive  instrument  make  written  requests  and  issue  orders  to operators or providers of electronic communications networks or services requiring them to intercept communications, provide any user information or otherwise in aid of law enforcement or national security.
texts.text: 83.The  President  may  by  executive  instrument  make  written  requests  and  issue  orders  to operators or providers of electronic communications networks or services requiring them to intercept communications, provide any user information or otherwise in aid of law enforcement or national security.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Regulations
texts.text: Regulations

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 84.(1)  The  Minister  may,  on  the  advice  of  the Authority,  by  legislative  instrument  make Regulations generally to give effect to the provisions of this Act and shall in particular, make Regulations in relation to
texts.text: 84.(1)  The  Minister  may,  on  the  advice  of  the Authority,  by  legislative  instrument  make Regulations generally to give effect to the provisions of this Act and shall in particular, make Regulations in relation to

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the procedure to be applied by a provider of a broadcasting service or a broadcasting organisation in relation to claims and complaints by customers;
texts.text: (a) the procedure to be applied by a provider of a broadcasting service or a broadcasting organisation in relation to claims and complaints by customers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the  procedures  for  the  administrative  adjudication,  mediation  or  arbitration  of disputes between operators and their subscribers;
texts.text: (b) the  procedures  for  the  administrative  adjudication,  mediation  or  arbitration  of disputes between operators and their subscribers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) the determination of breaches of the Regulations or conditions of the frequency authorisation and the nature of sanctions, impositions, warnings and other   penalties in respect of the breaches. ;
texts.text: (c) the determination of breaches of the Regulations or conditions of the frequency authorisation and the nature of sanctions, impositions, warnings and other   penalties in respect of the breaches. ;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) the  issue,  conditions,  duration,  suspension  or  revocation  of  licences  for  electronic communications service, as well as  frequency assignments and other authorisations relating to these services;
texts.text: (d) the  issue,  conditions,  duration,  suspension  or  revocation  of  licences  for  electronic communications service, as well as  frequency assignments and other authorisations relating to these services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) interconnection which may contain, among others, the matters to be covered in every interconnection agreement;
texts.text: (e) interconnection which may contain, among others, the matters to be covered in every interconnection agreement;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) procedures to be applied by a service provider to handle claims and complaints filed by subscribers or customers of communications services;
texts.text: (f) procedures to be applied by a service provider to handle claims and complaints filed by subscribers or customers of communications services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) conditions under which claims and complaints of communications services subscribers or  customers  which  are  not  satisfactorily  resolved  by  the  service  provider  may  be submitted  to  the  Authority,  and  the  procedures  to  be  applied  by  the  Authority  in handling the claims and complaints;
texts.text: (g) conditions under which claims and complaints of communications services subscribers or  customers  which  are  not  satisfactorily  resolved  by  the  service  provider  may  be submitted  to  the  Authority,  and  the  procedures  to  be  applied  by  the  Authority  in handling the claims and complaints;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) procedure for an integrated framework for robust, multi-hazard emergency communications on the declarations of an emergency in accordance with law;
texts.text: (h) procedure for an integrated framework for robust, multi-hazard emergency communications on the declarations of an emergency in accordance with law;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) other matters that the Board may from time to time consider necessary, having regard to the objectives and functions of the Authority,
texts.text: (i) other matters that the Board may from time to time consider necessary, having regard to the objectives and functions of the Authority,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (j) the parameters of what constitutes significant market power; and
texts.text: (j) the parameters of what constitutes significant market power; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (k) the  guidelines,  standards  and  other  requirements  that  the  Authority  may  issue  or specify.
texts.text: (k) the  guidelines,  standards  and  other  requirements  that  the  Authority  may  issue  or specify.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The Authority shall publish the Regulations on its website.
texts.text: The Authority shall publish the Regulations on its website.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3) Despite the Statutory Instruments Act, 1959 (No. 52) the penalty for contravention of the regulations shall be a fine of not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units.
texts.text: (3) Despite the Statutory Instruments Act, 1959 (No. 52) the penalty for contravention of the regulations shall be a fine of not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "public  electronic  communications  network"  means  an  electronic  communications  network used to provide public electronic communications services;
texts.text: "public  electronic  communications  network"  means  an  electronic  communications  network used to provide public electronic communications services;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "public electronic communications service" means a service provided to the public that permits users to communicate electronically with others, whether voice, data or multimedia, regardless of the technology used;
texts.text: "public electronic communications service" means a service provided to the public that permits users to communicate electronically with others, whether voice, data or multimedia, regardless of the technology used;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "public ground" includes any area open to or accessible by the public, whether or not enclosed;
texts.text: "public ground" includes any area open to or accessible by the public, whether or not enclosed;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "public  utility"  has  the  same  meaning  assigned  to  it  under  the  Public  Utilities  Regulatory Commission Act, 1997 (Act 538);
texts.text: "public  utility"  has  the  same  meaning  assigned  to  it  under  the  Public  Utilities  Regulatory Commission Act, 1997 (Act 538);

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "radiation"  means  the  emission  or  propagation  of  electromagnetic  waves  or  particles  from electronic communications equipment, including incidental or intentional emissions;
texts.text: "radiation"  means  the  emission  or  propagation  of  electromagnetic  waves  or  particles  from electronic communications equipment, including incidental or intentional emissions;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "road works" means any construction, installation, maintenance, or excavation work involving roads or  public  grounds  for  the  purpose  of  laying  or  accessing  electronic  communications infrastructure;
texts.text: "road works" means any construction, installation, maintenance, or excavation work involving roads or  public  grounds  for  the  purpose  of  laying  or  accessing  electronic  communications infrastructure;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "service  provider"  means  a  person  licensed  under  this  Act  to  provide  a  public  electronic communications service;
texts.text: "service  provider"  means  a  person  licensed  under  this  Act  to  provide  a  public  electronic communications service;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "significant interest" means a level of ownership or control in a licensee or authorisation holder which enables a person to influence decisions, directly or indirectly, and  includes  interests defined by the Authority and published in the Gazette;
texts.text: "significant interest" means a level of ownership or control in a licensee or authorisation holder which enables a person to influence decisions, directly or indirectly, and  includes  interests defined by the Authority and published in the Gazette;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "significant market power" means the ability of a network operator or service provider, either alone or jointly, to operate independently of competitive pressures in the market, particularly in pricing and service conditions;
texts.text: "significant market power" means the ability of a network operator or service provider, either alone or jointly, to operate independently of competitive pressures in the market, particularly in pricing and service conditions;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "single set of premises" means premises occupied and operated under the control of a single entity and not shared with unrelated parties;
texts.text: "single set of premises" means premises occupied and operated under the control of a single entity and not shared with unrelated parties;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "site restoration" means the process of rehabilitating a site previously occupied by electronic communications infrastructure to its original or approved condition following decommissioning;
texts.text: "site restoration" means the process of rehabilitating a site previously occupied by electronic communications infrastructure to its original or approved condition following decommissioning;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "space segment" means the part of a satellite communication system comprising satellites and their sensors and ground control components required for signal transmission and reception;
texts.text: "space segment" means the part of a satellite communication system comprising satellites and their sensors and ground control components required for signal transmission and reception;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "special interconnect" means an interconnection arrangement approved by the Authority that applies modified terms to enable service delivery in rural or underserved areas;
texts.text: "special interconnect" means an interconnection arrangement approved by the Authority that applies modified terms to enable service delivery in rural or underserved areas;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "special  licence"  means  a  licence  granted  by  the  Authority  under  exigent  circumstances  as defined in section 17 of this Act;
texts.text: "special  licence"  means  a  licence  granted  by  the  Authority  under  exigent  circumstances  as defined in section 17 of this Act;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "special licensee" means a person who holds a special licence;
texts.text: "special licensee" means a person who holds a special licence;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "spectrum"  means  the  range  of  electromagnetic  wave  frequencies  used  for  communication services;
texts.text: "spectrum"  means  the  range  of  electromagnetic  wave  frequencies  used  for  communication services;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "spectrum plan" means the official allocation framework developed by the Authority to guide the use and management of radio frequency bands for telecommunications and broadcasting purposes;
texts.text: "spectrum plan" means the official allocation framework developed by the Authority to guide the use and management of radio frequency bands for telecommunications and broadcasting purposes;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "structural remedies" means regulatory measures that alter the structure or assets of an operator or  service  provider,  including  divestiture,  separation,  or  transfer  of  control,  to  remedy  or prevent anti-competitive effects;
texts.text: "structural remedies" means regulatory measures that alter the structure or assets of an operator or  service  provider,  including  divestiture,  separation,  or  transfer  of  control,  to  remedy  or prevent anti-competitive effects;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "takedown mechanism" means a process established by a service provider or mandated by the Authority for the prompt removal or restriction of unlawful or harmful content transmitted via an electronic communications service;
texts.text: "takedown mechanism" means a process established by a service provider or mandated by the Authority for the prompt removal or restriction of unlawful or harmful content transmitted via an electronic communications service;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "telecentre" means a technology-enabled facility in a community that provides access to ICT services to the public;
texts.text: "telecentre" means a technology-enabled facility in a community that provides access to ICT services to the public;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "telecommunications"  includes  the  transmission,  emission  or  reception  of  signals,  writing, images,  sounds,  or  intelligence  of  any  nature  by  any  wire,  radio,  optical,  satellite  or  other electromagnetic system;
texts.text: "telecommunications"  includes  the  transmission,  emission  or  reception  of  signals,  writing, images,  sounds,  or  intelligence  of  any  nature  by  any  wire,  radio,  optical,  satellite  or  other electromagnetic system;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "terminal equipment" means equipment on the user side of the network termination point used to access, originate, or terminate communications;
texts.text: "terminal equipment" means equipment on the user side of the network termination point used to access, originate, or terminate communications;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "traffic  management"  means  the  technical  measures  employed  by  a  network  operator  to monitor, control, prioritise, or restrict data traffic on an electronic communications network in order to maintain network integrity or comply with regulatory obligations;
texts.text: "traffic  management"  means  the  technical  measures  employed  by  a  network  operator  to monitor, control, prioritise, or restrict data traffic on an electronic communications network in order to maintain network integrity or comply with regulatory obligations;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "transparency reporting" means the periodic disclosure by a service provider of information regarding  its  content  moderation,  data  requests,  takedown  actions,  and  compliance  with applicable laws;
texts.text: "transparency reporting" means the periodic disclosure by a service provider of information regarding  its  content  moderation,  data  requests,  takedown  actions,  and  compliance  with applicable laws;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Tribunal" means the Electronic Communications Tribunal established under section 72 of this Act;
texts.text: "Tribunal" means the Electronic Communications Tribunal established under section 72 of this Act;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "universal access" means community-based access to communications services as determined by the Authority in accordance with this Act;
texts.text: "universal access" means community-based access to communications services as determined by the Authority in accordance with this Act;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "universal  service"  means  public  communications  services  which  the  Authority  determines must be provided under universal service obligations;
texts.text: "universal  service"  means  public  communications  services  which  the  Authority  determines must be provided under universal service obligations;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "user" means a customer, subscriber or end-user of electronic communications or broadcasting services;
texts.text: "user" means a customer, subscriber or end-user of electronic communications or broadcasting services;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "utility installation" means physical infrastructure used by a public utility to deliver electricity, water, or gas;
texts.text: "utility installation" means physical infrastructure used by a public utility to deliver electricity, water, or gas;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "utility installation owner" means the owner or operator of a utility installation;
texts.text: "utility installation owner" means the owner or operator of a utility installation;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "value  added  service"  means  an  enhanced  electronic  communications  service  that  provides additional  features,  content  or  interactivity  beyond  standard  voice  or  data  transmission, including  streaming,  mobile  money,  and  internet-based  applications,  but  excluding  public electronic communications services.
texts.text: "value  added  service"  means  an  enhanced  electronic  communications  service  that  provides additional  features,  content  or  interactivity  beyond  standard  voice  or  data  transmission, including  streaming,  mobile  money,  and  internet-based  applications,  but  excluding  public electronic communications services.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Repeals and savings
texts.text: Repeals and savings

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 86. (1) The Electronic Communications Act, 2008 (Act 772) is hereby repealed.
texts.text: 86. (1) The Electronic Communications Act, 2008 (Act 772) is hereby repealed.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) Despite the repeal under subsection (1), licences, frequency authorisations, notices or other act made or done lawfully under the repealed enactment and in force immediately before the coming into force of this Act, which are not inconsistent with this Act shall be considered to have  been  made  under  this Act  and  shall  continue  to  have  effect  until  revoked,  reviewed, cancelled, terminated or upon its expiration.
texts.text: (2) Despite the repeal under subsection (1), licences, frequency authorisations, notices or other act made or done lawfully under the repealed enactment and in force immediately before the coming into force of this Act, which are not inconsistent with this Act shall be considered to have  been  made  under  this Act  and  shall  continue  to  have  effect  until  revoked,  reviewed, cancelled, terminated or upon its expiration.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3) The Act shall not affect the repealed enactment in the operation of offences committed, penalties imposed or proceedings commenced before the coming into force of this Act.
texts.text: (3) The Act shall not affect the repealed enactment in the operation of offences committed, penalties imposed or proceedings commenced before the coming into force of this Act.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Modifications of existing enactments
texts.text: Modifications of existing enactments

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 87. (1) The provisions of any enactment relevant to this Act and in existence before the coming into force of this Act shall have effect subject to such modifications necessary to give effect to this Act.
texts.text: 87. (1) The provisions of any enactment relevant to this Act and in existence before the coming into force of this Act shall have effect subject to such modifications necessary to give effect to this Act.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) Where there is a conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Act and any other enactment relevant to this Act, the provisions of this Act shall prevail.
texts.text: (2) Where there is a conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Act and any other enactment relevant to this Act, the provisions of this Act shall prevail.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Transitional Provisions
texts.text: Transitional Provisions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 88. A licence, frequency authorisation, permit or certificate issued by the National Communications Authority in respect of electronic communications, spectrum, or broadcasting services shall remain valid until it is revoked, cancelled, terminated by the Authority, or expires in accordance with its terms.
texts.text: 88. A licence, frequency authorisation, permit or certificate issued by the National Communications Authority in respect of electronic communications, spectrum, or broadcasting services shall remain valid until it is revoked, cancelled, terminated by the Authority, or expires in accordance with its terms.
